headline: Awesome Carrot Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting
description: This straightforward recipe delivers moist, dense, and delicious carrot cake with pineapple under a cream cheese frosting.

video.description: This carrot cake is dense and delicious, a real crowd-pleaser.
video.name: Awesome Carrot Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting

name: Awesome Carrot Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting
recipeIngredient: 1 (8 ounce) can crushed pineapple with juice

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x13 inch pan.

In a large bowl, combine grated carrots, flour, white sugar, baking soda, baking powder, salt and cinnamon. Stir in eggs, oil, 1 1/4 teaspoon vanilla, pineapple and 3/4 cup chopped pecans. Spoon batter into prepared pan.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Allow to cool.

To Make Frosting: In a medium bowl, combine confectioners' sugar, Neufchatel cheese, 1/2 cup butter or margarine and 1 1/4 teaspoons vanilla. Beat until smooth, then stir in 1 cup chopped pecans. Spread on cooled cake.

review.reviewBody: Awesome and simply easy to make
I hate how good this is! Now my family and coworkers expect me to make it all the time. Again, I hate how good this is!!
This carrot cake is great, so moist and flavorful. I did find that I liked it's moisture content better the next day, next time I will make it a day ahead.
SO GOOD!! I make this every year for my husband's birthday. We leave out the pecans because we're not big nut lovers, but everything else we follow exactly. Best carrot cake I've ever had!
Great and easy to make.....
First time making a cake that wasn’t from a box! It was delicious. I didn’t have any pecans so I substituted walnuts and almonds. I also toasted them before I put them in the batter.
Excellent !
Our favorite recipe!! We prefer without the frosting.
The best carrot cake I’ve ever had!
My husband really liked it also very good

I made this as a triple layer cake. Instead of 3/4 cup oil are used one cup of applesauce and 1/2 cup of oil. I also added 1/8 teaspoon allspice. I cooked it 20 minutes on 350, all three pans at once. It turned out beautifully!??
awesome...

It is a delicious and easy cake to make. My guests loved it and asked for the recipe.
I cut back on the sugar for the cake and the frosting.
I didn’t have applesauce so I added more olive oil making it 1/2 cup instead of the 1/4 cup.
I had to make conversions for the 8 ounce pineapple to 1cup as I am in Australia.
Thank you for the great recipe.

I made a few changes such as changed cream to cream cheese, not the one they had as well as raisins . But, over all we were very pleased. It was my first time to make a cake from scratch and it came out fantastic. Now I'm in trouble because my wife expects it more often. And before this I had a hard time making scrambled eggs.

Excellent recipe- .
I use all the pineapple juice for more taste of the pineapple.
No changes
Hands down most flavorful moist carrot cake I ever made !!
i made it . Its really tasty Carrot Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting
Fantastic! I added raisins. Made it in a square 8” and split it so it was 4 layers of deliciousness!!!

I’m guessing this recipe has been edited since so many reviews complained about too much oil. I made exactly to the recipe (only 1/4 cup of oil) and it was deliciously moist. The frosting was not overly sweet. I will make this again.

I have been making this cake for years, WITH the 1 1/2 c. of oil as the original recipe stated and it is my “go-to” recipe for carrot cake, hands down!!!!! It’s not too oily and is the perfect texture. I’ve made this cake and SOLD numerous of them with customers always wanting the recipe. Flawless recipe as it was.
Amazing
It was delicious. Only changes i made was used walnuts instead of pecans, 3/4 cup oil like someone suggested, didnt use applesauce, did not drain pineapple cooked for 40minutes. Came out perfect!

Its good, the frosting makes up the cake so the batter might need something else in it. I'm not too eager to try other recipes though because this one is still good. I might try the one that calls for buttermilk (on this website) someday. Make sure your cream cheese sits out for a few hours at room temperature and cake batter will be a little runny cause of the apple sauce, pineapples etc.

My ten year old made this carrot cake today. He followed the recipe on the video without the nuts (3/4 oil, can of pineapple + juice) and reduced the sugar to 1 cup as recommended in another review. The carrot cake was phenomenal. We used the KitchenAid shredder attachment for the carrots and it worked perfectly. We also used our KitchenAid to mix the ingredients. This will be our go to baked item from now on. So delicious!
Amazing! I’ve been making this cake for over 11 years and it always gets rave reviews! It has even won two local bake off competitions!
My favorite cake so far. Usually only make half the size because I'm usually the only ones eating it in my house.

I followed the recipe except for the frosting and baking. I baked the batter in 2 9 inch cake pans for 30 minutes with well greased parchment paper on the bottoms of the pans . The cakes came out without any problems. When cool, I removed the parchment paper. I creamed the butter and cream cheese until soft then added the sugar. I did not add the nuts to the frosting. I put 1/3 cup chopped nuts in between the layers and put some on top as a decoration.

I doubled the recipe so a can have two layers of 9 by 13. I used an extra cup of carrot and a cup less sugar. I did sift the dry ingredients before mixing with the carrots and wet ingredients! Everyone loved it!

I only see 1/4 cup oil in the recipe, so I followed it as is. I haven't even made the frosting yet, and it's a great, moist, yummy recipe. One word to the wise, the batter is too wet to use cupcake papers with. Comes out nicely from a greased and floured pan, though.
Great recipe; dense moist cake, delicious icing.
Amazing recipe, very moist. I added raisins. Thank you for sharing.

way tooo much oil, somebody please fix the amount of oil!!!!

when corrected to just 1/2 cup it was just fine! Tried it a second time substutuing oil for 1/2 cup applesauce and it was even better!
Excecllent and easy to make. The family loves this cake. The pineapple doesn't overpower, in fact it adds sweetness and moisture and if I didn't tell them it was in there, they would not have known.
Used gluten free flour and served for Easter. (used a crustless cheesecake for the filling) It went fast!
I followed the recipe as listed..... loved it! Definitely recommend it. Neither the cake nor the frosting were too sweet.

I increased the recipe by half (i.e. 4.5 c grated carrots, etc.) as I wanted to use two 9" x 2" round baking pans to make a layer cake. I drained the pineapple (14 oz can) and used half of the liquid rather than all of it, threw in about 1/2 c raisins, used half brown and half white sugar rather than all white, and cut the amount of sugar in the icing by half. I'd suggest lining the bottom of the pans with parchment paper as the cakes were hard to get out of the greased&floured pans without breaking. It turned out wonderfully - one of the best carrot cakes I've had.
This cake always turns out great Family loves it I find that you have to cook it longer than 30 mon
No changes and yes I will make it again. I took my cake to a luncheon where it was enjoyed by all except my vegan friend because of the butter and cheese.

Have been making this cake for years ( maybe 10 times a year) and wonder why anyone would have to use a mixer to blend the ingredients of the cake part? Also do substitute 2/3 of the oil for unsweetened applesauce with a better texture cake.
I was looking for a recipe that was similar to one I had lost. This one fit the bill. Did not make any changes, family loved it!
I only used a quarter cup oil and substituted the rest with applesauce --made for Thanksgiving and it all disappeared. Delicious !
I follow the recipe every s time I made this cake and it came out delicious.
This cake is so moist and delicious! I like to add a 3/4 cup of raisin soaked in orange juice. I use either golden or regular raisins. Great recipe thank you for sharing.

I can only rate this cream cheese frosting. I have another recipe for carrot cake that I love but I did not have a good recipe for the frosting. This frosting came out great as written. I will be making it again.

Have made this multiple times. Especially an Easter staple now. I use a different cream cheese frosting but this cake cannot be beat. My dad, husband, father in law, everyone insists on this. I do it in two 9 inch and stack.

worked well when I followed the recommendations from others in the forum and reduced the oil & sugar content but it did take longer to bake than the 40 mins recommended. I haven't baked with applesauce before but was impressed with the result. I substituted 3/4 cup apple sauce for 3/4 cup of the 11/2 cups oil in the original recipe & reduced the sugar to 1 cup
Very moist cake and the frosting is delicious. I got rave reviews when I baked it for a friends birthday party. He loves carrot cake and thought this was one of the best that he had ever eaten.

My favorite recipe for my favorite cake. As others have done I subbed 1 cup of applesauce and 1/2 cup oil for the 1 1/2 cups of oil. I think we do this out of habit, but it's a healthy habit and this cake didn't suffer for it.

I used the ingredients exactly as written. The only thing I changed was the technique. After reading many reviews with people reporting that the cake was oily, I did something different. With my hand-held blender, I whipped the eggs until light yellow and frothy. Then with the blender still running I added the oil in very small increments (roughly a tablespoon at a time) beating well after each addition. The egg/oil combination became a thin mayonnaise. The finished product was not oily at all because the oil was emulsified. I added the carrots to the wet ingredients instead of the dry. I baked the cake in a bundt pan for 55 minutes. The finished cake, with the icing, was absolutely delicious! I gave it 4 stars because it needs a little more spice. Next time I make this I'm going to triple the cinnamon and add more vanilla. I may add some maple extract, too. I love this cake. As others have noted, it is better the next day.

I remember first making this cake back in 2005. This is the ONLY recipe i use. I've tinkered with it throughout the years. From adding more sugar, more pineapples, more carrots, 1/2 wheat 1/2 white and it always turns out delicious. I only use 3/4 cup of oil, 1/2 might do but I have never tried that. It gets 5 stars because other than the oil it is a really awesome recipe. I've used cream cheese and Neufchatel cheese and I think the frosting tastes better with cream cheese although the other way is good as well. I recommend sifting the flour 2 or 3 times. King Arthur Flour seems to make it a better tasting cake although i have not made two at the same time to compare, It just seems to be less dense. I have recently started tinkering with the time and temperature. 325 degrees for 50-55 minutes has worked well. This seems to keep the edges from "overbaking"

A few years ago I ate this dessert in a pizza restaurant in Brighton Ontario.
Since that day , I tested several recipes if there was like that .
Until today I did this recipe.
It was so good, very delicious !!! Finally I found the recipe of this dessert that fascinates me and now I can eat anytime. Thanks!!!!
I read the reviews and the only changes I made were: 3/4 cup of oil , 1/2 cup of coconut, and drain the juice off pineapple. And instead of pecans I put almonds.

I did make a few chances and took a lot of advice for others that had made it.

I used a half cup of oil..
I used 4 table spoon of floor because it was still a lil running for me..
 The frosting I use 16oz of cream cheese and one cup of soft butter. I shift the 3 cups of power sugar.
The reason I used 16oz cream cheese and not the 8 oz is because I made to.
Also I used 8 in pan.

But my husband love it... I personally do not like carrot cake. But if he like it then it most be really good ????

I tried making this recipe bc of the great reveiws. I definitely should have read the reveiws FIRST bc most of them have altered the recipe to make it edible. As it is written, there is waaay too much oil. My baked for an hour plus and is still like soup except that most of it has exploded over the edge of the pan to make a soupy mess all over my oven. Really disappointed in this recipe.
Husband loves carrot cake with cream cheese frosting. He said this the best.
Too much oil in this recipe.

Yes, this is best recipe yet. My granny made this every holiday. I have not made this since she passed away. But I think it's time. Kids that don't like pineapple or carrots or cream cheese will love this cake. They have no idea what's in it. You do not need to change this recipe, it is excellent as is.
Best carrot cake ever! I have made it dozens of times and it is requested often!

When I made this swapped 1 cup of white sugar for brown sugar, added 1 tsp of fresh ground nutmeg, 2 Tbsp cinnamon and 1/2 cup of golden raisins. The oil could really be cut back of this cake but that just to my tastes. Also used cream cheese frosting with candy pecans and candy bacon.

I actually made this for my brother's birthday and he is a big carrot cake fan, he loved it, everyone loved it and they couldn't believe it had cream cheese. The only changed I was forced to make was less carrots (2 cups)and less oil (1 cup), only because I ran out and I didn't have pecans so instead I added almonds. Also I didn't add the nuts to the frosting I just threw all the nut of the top of the cake, to make it look nicer-ish. The ONLY PROBLEM I had was the frosting was very creamy and wouldn't stay put so I frosted it three separate times and I had it in the refrigerator for at least 3 hrs-ish so I guess just add more powered sugar to the frosting or refrigerate for a least 3 hrs.

Traveling and didn't have my "Tried and True" carrot cake recipe, so after reading SEVERAL recipes on this site and others, I opted for this recipe ! It is AMAZING! I did cut the oil to 1 cup since I remembered the amount from my recipe. I think I have a NEW tried and true! Great recipe, those that didn't like it - don't know what to tell you. Give it another try!

I am about to make this cake and after reading a dozen or so recipes this is the closest to my mother in-laws that I unfortunately misplaced. I cannot believe all the revising of ingredients and expectations of it tasting as the recipe was written! If you want to write your own recipes DO IT!!

I'm not usually a big fan of sweets, but I have a weakness for carrot cake. My old boss used to make a super moist carrot cake that used pineapples and I've been looking for a recipe that used it ever since. I followed the video recipe version since it used 1/2 the amount of oil than the written recipe. But also made a few small changes.. I increased the amount of carrots to 4 cups, added around 3/4 cup of raisins and decreased the sugar to just a little over 1 cup so it's not too sweet. I baked it for 40min and it turned out amazing! Super moist, not overly sweet, and definitely not greasy at all. Next time, I'm going to check it at the 30-35min mark and see if it's even more moist.
This is our go-to recipe for Carrot Cake every time - exactly as written! Love it and have had to give the recipe out many times
We changed the recipe slightly like the other reviews said, and it turned out great!
I use large carrots and grate them finely. Also, I cut the oil down to 1 cup, and they cake is still good but much less greasy.
I had to cook much longer than 40 minutes!!! Love the icing!!

This cake has way too much oil. I really like the flavor. It has the perfect amount of carrots, and is not spiced so much that it covers up the carrot taste. However, the recipe calls for too much oil. I made it 3 times and the last time I CUT THE OIL DOWN TO ABOUT 1 1/8TH CUP and it turned out great. I had to rate the recipe as it is written so I gave it 3 stars.
It was completely unedible, oily and crusty on top and not even baked in the middle!!!
I made this for our Christmas Eve dinner...Oh my gosh ~ Amazing! So moist and the frosting - wow! It's great! Enjoy!

The cake looked so tempting when it was in the pan.... just perfect.....The surprise came when you put it in your mouth. It tasted like a funnel cake with carrots and some nuts in it. Followed the recipe word by word with utmost care and so disappointed with the outcome. Maybe it needs some whipping and then just fold the nuts and carrots in it. Not even motivated to alter it a bit with suggestions. I just wonder seeing all the five stars as where I could've gone wrong.
1cup unsweet apple sauce and 1/2c oil, instead 1 1/2c oil
Followed this recipe exactly. It was very tasty but too oily. Will cut oil in half next time.
This is an awesome cake all i say is to take away half a cup of oil; it well make it less moist .

After preparing the cake ingredients, I thought there were way too many carrots. I'm so glad I just went ahead and baked it. It is wonderful! It is moist with an incredible texture! The cream cheese frosting is light and the perfect compliment to the cake. This is definitely my go to carrot cake!! I've also added more spice and raisins for a little variation.

I didn't change the recipe while I was making it,but when ready to put into cake pan,I didn't like how runny it was so added 1/2 cup of flour,like other reviewers I cut back on the sugar in the frosting. I didn't read the reviews before making, maybe the xtra flour fixed the oily texure. I didn't have crushed pineapple,used pineapple rings chopped up and about 1/4 cup of the juice
I had to cook it a little over a hour(I live at high altitude)to get a solid cake. I liked it,maybe I'll over do it next time and add some raisins
This recipe was amazing. The perfect combination of texture and taste. I have made it several times and followed the recipe exactly. I've gotten rave reviews every time.

Yes, I have and this is the BEST carrot cake that I've eaten. It's moist and yummy. It's not dry like the majority carrot cakes I've tried. This is the best recipe so far that I have found. Try it, you'll love it!
It's all in the name. Awesome!
i liked it but to much oil I'd cut it down a notch :) but on the other hand very good !!! :D

I tried this recipe today and used the suggestion from others to substitute 1 cup of non-sweetened apple sauce and 1/2 cup oil for the 1 1/2 cups of oil the recipe calls for and it worked well. I also added 1/2 c golden raisins and rather than baking in a 9x13 pan, I split the batter between two 8 1/2" rounds. While I liked the recipe, I would puree the pineapple next time as it was rather chunky for my tastes.

OMG!just finished making it and it is way to watery. Don't put as much oil as it says on the recipe, i didn't get to read the feedbacks before I baked my cake uugh what a bummer!!and don't put the juice of the pineapple. Im going to try this again. :(

Delicious!!! My first time making a carrot cake and it was easy and so delicious. I followed the recipe exact the only difference is the baking pan I used was a bunt pan and it baked beautifully -- I would not change.

I should have read more of the reviews before trying this carrot cake recipe. The cake comes out WAY too oily!! If 
i made it again I'd reduce the amount of oil used (maybe 3/4 cup) and substitute something like apple sauce to maintain the moisture. Moist is great, but there are better ways to achieve a moist cake without resorting to so much oil. Also I'd increase the amount of sugar in the cake batter (the cake comes out barely sweet), maybe use 2 cups rather than a cup and a half. I'm not one for really sugary cakes, but this one needs a bit more sugar. 

If you had to make major adjustments to the recipe, how can you rate it five stars? Please rate the recipe as it appears, not how it turned out when you recreated the recipe to make it palatable.
I thought this was easy to understand and I enjoyed spendiing the time with my granddaughters creating this delicious desert. Santa won't be getting cookies this year. Thank you so much.

I found this recipe years ago, and have been making it ever since! I make this cake every year for Thanksgiving and Christmas, and my family LOVES it. I did change a few things: 1. I beat the eggs seperately, then gradually add the oil....whisking until light in color. Then I add the pinapple, carrots, and nuts, and mix. I mix the flour, sugar, and spices together in a seperate bowl, and gradually add to the wet mixture. I find this makes for a lighter, fluffier cake. 2. For the icing, I use 1 stick unsalted butter, and 1/2 "brick" of cream cheese. Makes for a lighter, creamier icing. Also, because of the pineapple, this cake MUST be kept refrigerated...the moisture from the pineapple will make it go bad quickly if not kept at a cool temperture...
I reduced the oil in the cake from 1 and 1/2 cup to 1 cup, the cake came out delicious!!

My boyfriend had been begging me for weeks to make him a carrot cake w/cream cheese icing from scratch. Mind you, I cook a lot of dinners, but have never been much of a bake from scratch kind of gal. But then I found this recipe and thought it looked easy enough so I decided to give it a shot. Even my bf wasn't excepting it to be perfect the first time, he just wanted me to try, BUT it came out SO freaking good. He was in love, the kids were in love, and I myself was in love with this cake. I know a lot of the other reviewers thought it was TOO oily and moist, but we thought it was just right. Maybe it's just a matter of preference, maybe I just got lucky, but , that was some good cake! I'm making another one to bring to a party tonight, we'll see if it's as big of a hit for my friends as it was for my family!
I have made this several time and everyone loves it, even people who don't like carrot! I do use only 1/2 the amount of oil, stir delicious! I serve it cold for best results!

I made this last night and it was the best carrot cake I have ever tasted. I followed the recipe as it was written and tweaked it a little bit, I added raisens. It was a hit on our home and I will keep this one as my favorite. Thank you.
This is the best carrot cake I've ever made. Lots of compliments always.
Love this recipe
very good, but add some spices to the frosting to make it even better

Perfect recipe!!! I have never had a bad carrot cake with this one - I don't use the nuts for the simple fact that I am unsure if the people I am baking for will enjoy/are allergic to them but I am sure it is delicious!! If you love carrot cake I would highly recommend this one!!
It was good, but I agree with the too much oil comment, seems excessive!! Icing makes too much, more than needed.
Good flavor. I think I will cut back on the oil next time. Made it as a layer cake and the icing was almost too much for it.
the frosting is amazing! and the cake is just sooo good!i would love to make this every Easter! maybe everyday lol

This one is fool proof! I happily assembled the ingredients and just as I was going to 'pour' it into the pans....the word 'spooned' from the recipe came to me. I realized that the tin of pinapple I had used was 14 oz not 8, so in a mad panic I threw in another cup or so of flour, and more baking soda and baking powder, mixed and then panned and baked. The cake looks great! I will definitely do this one again, but I'll cut the pinapple & juice in half. 

C

I actually used box cake mix BUT used this recipe for the frosting which turned out AWESOME!!!

Wonderful compliments on my carrot cake cupcakes and the credit goes to the frosting.

item.name: Awesome Carrot Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting
